alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 3:39PM EST until January 25 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...The northern Adirondacks, northern Champlain Valley, and eastern Vermont. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Isolated power outages are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be two rounds of winter precipitation. Snow will develop across the region from south to north this evening and tonight, leading to a slippery Wednesday morning commute. After a brief lull midday, precipitation returns as freezing rain Wednesday evening and continues into early Thursday morning before tapering off by midday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
